sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the Committee Determines NEO Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective August 1, 2008, SERP participants whose SERP benefits were not calculated under the pre-1998 formula had their SERP benefits frozen such that they ceased to earn additional benefits for compensation or service earned on or after that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until benefits commence, such participants frozen benefits are periodically adjusted to reflect increases in a specified cost-of-living index (i.e., the consumer price index for all urban consumers published by the U.S. Department of Labor Bureau of Statistics for U.S. all items less food and energy).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lougee and Mr. Mayman are the only NEOs affected by this change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SERP benefits are generally paid in the form of a lump sum amount when a participant separates from service or, if later, the date the participant attains age 55, except that payment is accelerated in the event that the Company undergoes a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to comply with federal tax laws, an NEOs SERP benefit cannot be paid within the first six months after the participants separation from service with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Martore, Mr. Lougee, Mr. Williams and Mr. Mayman are fully vested in their SERP benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TEGNA 401(k) Savings Plan (401(k) Plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most of the Companys employees based in the United States may participate in the TEGNA 401(k) Savings Plan (401(k) Plan), which permits eligible participants to make pre-tax contributions and provides for matching and other employer contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective August 1, 2008, new participants as well as participants whose benefits have been frozen under the TRP and, if applicable, the SERP, commenced receiving higher matching contributions under the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time, the matching contribution rate generally increased from 50% of the first 6% of compensation that an employee elects to contribute to the plan to 100% of the first 5% of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Harker, Mr. Lougee and Mr. Mayman receive matching contributions under the new formula, and Ms. Martore and Mr. Williams receive matching contributions under the old formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also makes additional employer contributions to the 401(k) Plan on behalf of certain employees, including a contribution to Mr. Mayman equal to 1.5% of his cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the 401(k) Plan and subject to Internal Revenue Code limits, compensation generally includes a participants base salary, performance-based bonuses, and pre-tax contributions to the Companys benefit plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company contributions under the 401(k) Plan vest 25% after one year of service, 50% after two years of service and 100% after three years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, Company contributions are 100% vested for each of the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TEGNA Deferred Compensation Plan (DCP)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO who participates in the DCP may elect to defer all or a portion of his or her compensation under the DCP, provided that the minimum deferral must be $5,000 for each form of compensation (base salary and bonus) for the year of deferral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts deferred by each NEO are vested and will be deemed invested in the fund or funds designated by such NEO from among a number of funds offered under the DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DCP provides for Company contributions on behalf of certain employees whose benefits under the 401(k) Plan are capped by Internal Revenue Code rules that limit the amount of compensation that can be taken into account when calculating benefits under a qualified plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, Company contributions to the DCP are calculated by applying the same formula that applies to an employees matching and additional employer contributions under the 401(k) Plan to the employees compensation in excess of the Internal Revenue Code compensation limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, participants are not required to make elective contributions to the DCP to receive an employer contribution under the DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company contributions under the DCP vest 25% after one year of service, 50% after two years of service and 100% after three years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Harker, Mr. Lougee and Mr. Mayman each has been credited with Company contributions to the DCP based on his or her respective 2016 compensation in excess of the Internal Revenue Code compensation limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of Ms. Harker, Mr. Lougee and Mr. Mayman was immediately vested in his or her Company contribution when it was made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives who continue to accrue reduced benefits under the SERP after August 1, 2008, including Ms. Martore and Mr. Williams, do not receive Company contributions under the DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts that a participant elects to defer into the DCP are generally paid at the time and in the form elected by the participant, provided that if the participant terminates employment before attaining age 55 and completing five years of service, benefits are paid in a lump sum amount upon such termination (although for pre-2005 deferrals the Committee may pay such deferrals in five annual installments).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DCP permits participants to receive in-service withdrawals of participant contributions for unforeseeable emergencies and certain other circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to when the deferrals are made, a participant may make a special election as to the time and form of payment for benefits that become payable due to the participants death or disability if payments have not already commenced, and deferrals will be paid in accordance with such elections under those circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company contributions to the DCP are generally paid in the form of a lump sum amount when a participant separates from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payment of post-2004 Company and participant DCP contributions is accelerated in the event that the Company undergoes a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TEGNA Transitional Compensation Plan (TCP)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TCP provides severance pay for our NEOs and other key executives upon a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TCP assures the Company that it would have the continued dedication of, and the availability of objective advice and counsel from, key executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the Committee Determines NEO Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: notwithstanding the possibility, threat or occurrence of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we believe the TCP helps promote the retention and continuity of certain key executives for at least one year after a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes it is imperative that the Company and the Board be able to rely upon key executives to continue in their positions and be available for advice, if requested, in connection with any proposal relating to a change in control without concern that those individuals might be distracted by the personal uncertainties and risks created by such a proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in control arrangements also facilitate the Companys ability to attract and retain management as the Company competes for talented employees in a marketplace where such protections are common.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With those goals in mind, the TCP provides that participants, including the NEOs, would be entitled to compensation following a change in control if (1) within two years from the date of the change in control the participants employment is terminated by the Company other than for cause, or by the employee for good reason, or (2) in the case of executives participating in the TCP before April 15, 2010 (but not those who first participate in the TCP on or after that date), within a 30-day window period beginning on the first anniversary of the change in control, the executive terminates his or her employment voluntarily.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Harker first participated in the TCP after April 15, 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although Mr. Lougee first participated in the TCP before April 15, 2010, following the completion of the Cars.com Spin-off, when he is expected to succeed Ms. Martore as President and CEO of the Company, he will give up his modified single trigger vesting right.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following is a summary of several key terms of the TCP:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: change in control means the first to occur of: (1) the acquisition of 20% or more of our then-outstanding shares of common stock or the combined voting power of our then-outstanding voting securities; (2) our incumbent directors cease to constitute at least a majority of the Board, except in connection with the election of directors approved by a vote of at least a majority of the directors then comprising the incumbent Board; (3) consummation of our sale in a merger or similar transaction or sale or other disposition of all or substantially all of our assets; or (4) approval by our shareholders of the Companys complete liquidation or dissolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cause means (1) any material misappropriation of Company funds or property; (2) the executives unreasonable and persistent neglect or refusal to perform his or her duties which is not remedied in a reasonable period of time following notice from the Company; or (3) conviction of a felony involving moral turpitude.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: good reason means the occurrence after a change in control of any of the following without the participants express written consent, unless fully corrected prior to the date of termination: (1) a material diminution of an executives duties or responsibilities; (2) a reduction in, or failure to pay timely, the executives compensation and/or other benefits or perquisites; (3) the relocation of the executives office outside the Washington, D.C. metropolitan area or away from the Companys headquarters; (4) the failure of the Company or any successor to assume and agree to perform the TCP; or (5) any purported termination of the executives employment other than in accordance with the TCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any good faith determination of good reason made by the executive shall be conclusive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: severance period means a number of whole months equal to the participants months of continuous service with the Company or its affiliates divided by 3.33; provided, however, that in no event shall the participants severance period be less than 24 months or more than 36 months, regardless of the participants actual length of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the severance periods for Ms. Martore, Ms. Harker, Mr. Lougee, Mr. Williams and Mr. Mayman are 36, 24, 33.6, 36 and 36 months, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A NEO entitled to compensation under the TCP would receive:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excise Tax Gross-Ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives participating in the TCP before April 15, 2010 (but not those who first participated in the TCP on or after that date) would be entitled to receive payment of an amount sufficient to make them whole for any excise tax imposed on the payment under Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effects of Section 4999 generally are unpredictable and can have widely divergent and unexpected effects based on an executives personal compensation history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, to provide an equal level of benefit across individuals without regard to the effect of the excise tax, the Company has determined that excise tax gross-up payments are appropriate for certain TCP participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives, such as Ms. Harker, who first participated in the TCP on or after April 15, 2010, will not receive a Section 4999 excise tax gross-up payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although Mr. Lougee first participated in the TCP before April 15, 2010, following the completion of the Cars.com Spin-off, when he is expected to succeed Ms. Martore as President and CEO of the Company, he will give up his right to receive a Section 4999 excise tax gross-up payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change of control benefits for executives who are not entitled to receive a Section 4999 excise tax gross-up payment will be reduced to $1 less than the amount that would trigger such taxes if such a reduction would put them in a better after-tax position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Medical and Life Insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of determining a TCP participants eligibility for retiree life insurance and medical benefits, the participant is considered to have attained the age and service credit that the participant would have attained had the participant remained employed until the end of the severance period.

sentences.text: Additionally, each TCP participant receives life and medical insurance benefits for the severance period in amounts no less than those that would have been provided had the participant not been terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On December 8, 2015, the Company, consistent with its practice of updating its plans and programs from time to time in light of evolving market trends, froze participation in the TCP and, effective December 15, 2016, additional service credit accruals for existing participants.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On December 8, 2015, the Company adopted the TEGNA Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Severance Plan (TESP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan provides severance payments to the NEOs (other than Ms. Martore) and other executives of the Company approved by the Committee in the event of certain involuntary terminations of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the TESP, a participant who experiences an involuntary termination of employment without cause would receive a lump-sum cash severance payment equal to the product of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) a severance multiple; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the sum of the participants (1) annual base salary and (2) average annual bonus earned for the three fiscal years immediately preceding the termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance multiple is 2.0 for a future participant who is the Companys Chief Executive Officer, 1.5 for a participant who is a member of the Companys executive leadership team who reports directly to the Companys Chief Executive Officer, and 1.0 for all other participating executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, participating executives would receive a lump sum amount equal to the sum of (1) any unpaid base salary or bonus through the date of termination; and (2) a prorated annual bonus for the portion of the fiscal year elapsed prior to the termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance payment is contingent upon the participants execution of a separation agreement containing a release of claims in favor of the Company and its affiliates and covenants restricting the participants competition, solicitation of employees, disparagement of the Company and its affiliates, and disclosure of confidential information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The separation agreement also contains a release of claims by the Company and its affiliates in favor of the participant and a covenant restricting the Companys disparagement of the participant.

sentences.text: Other Compensation Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOUPMENT POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has adopted a recoupment or clawback policy that applies to cash-based and equity-based incentive compensation awards granted to the Companys employees, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, to the extent permitted by applicable law and subject to the approval of the Committee, the Company may seek to recoup any incentive based compensation awarded to any employee subject to the policy, if (1) the Company is required to prepare an accounting restatement due to the material noncompliance with any financial reporting requirement under the securities laws, (2) the fraud or intentional misconduct of an employee subject to the policy contributed to the noncompliance that resulted in the obligation to restate, and (3) a lower award of incentive-based compensation would have been made to the covered employee had it been based upon the restated financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy is in addition to any other remedies the Company may have, including those available under Section 304 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, as amended.

sentences.text: HEDGING, SHORT-SELLING AND PLEDGING POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has adopted a policy that prohibits the Companys employees and directors from purchasing financial instruments that are designed to hedge or offset any fluctuations in the market value of the Companys equity securities they hold, purchasing the Companys shares on margin and selling any securities of the Company short.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also prohibits the Companys directors and executive officers from borrowing against any account in which the Companys equity securities are held or pledging the Companys equity securities as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These prohibitions apply whether or not such equity securities were acquired through the Companys equity compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally disallows a tax deduction to public corporations for compensation over $1,000,000 paid to a companys CEO and its three other most highly compensated executive officers other than the CFO for any fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Section 162(m) exempts qualifying performance-based compensation from the deduction limit if specified requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has structured, and intends to continue to structure, certain performance-based compensation, including Performance Shares and annual bonuses, to executive officers who may be subject to Section 162(m) in a manner that is intended to satisfy those requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in February 2016, the Committee established a limit on 2016 NEO annual bonuses based on a percentage of the Companys adjusted EBITDA for the purpose of preserving their deductibility under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee reserves the authority to award non-deductible compensation in circumstances as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of ambiguities and uncertainties as to the application and interpretation of Section 162(m) and the regulations issued thereunder, no assurance can be given, notwithstanding our efforts, that compensation intended by the Company to satisfy the requirements for deductibility under Section 162(m) does in fact do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, $1,648,692 of the compensation paid to Ms. Martore, $341,463 of the compensation paid to Mr. Lougee, $53,037 of the compensation paid to Mr. Williams and $124,493 of the compensation paid to Mr. Mayman was not deductible under Section 162(m).

sentences.text: Proposal 3Approval, on an Advisory Basis, of the Compensation of Our Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Again this year, consistent with our practice since 2011, we are asking shareholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensati of the Companys named executive officers (NEOs) as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the related executive compensation tables, notes and narrative included on pages 15-49 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement, the Executive Compensation Committee oversees the Companys executive compensation programs and supports compensation policies that place a heavy emphasis on pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation Committee also recognizes the importance of competitive compensation programs that are essential to recruiting and retaining the key executive talent needed to drive shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation plans, principles and programs, as currently structured and as implemented for 2016, strongly align the interests of our NEOs with those of our shareholders and also permit the Company to attract, retain and motivate talented executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge you to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 15 of this Proxy Statement, which describes in more detail the principles that guide the Committees compensation decisions and the components of our executive compensation plans and programs, as well as the Summary Compensation and other related executive compensation tables and narrative, beginning on page 34 of this Proxy Statement, which provide detailed information on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends that the shareholders of the Company vote FOR adoption of the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the shareholders of TEGNA Inc. approve the compensation of the Companys named executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the related discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approval of this Proposal 3 on an advisory basis requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes that could be cast by the hareholders present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the advisory vote we are asking you to cast is non-binding, the Companys Executive Compensation Committee and the Board value the views of our hareholders and will take the outcome into account when considering future compensation decisions affecting our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4Vote, on an Advisory Basis, on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes to Approve the Compensation of Our Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least every six years, we are required to hold a separate non-binding, advisory shareholder vote with respect to the frequency of future votes we will hold on the Say on Pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companies must give shareholders the choice of whether to cast an advisory vote on the Say on Pay proposal every year, every two years or every three years (commonly known as the Frequency Vote on Say on Pay).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may also abstain from making a choice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, the Board of Directors believes that our current executive compensation programs closely link executive compensation to our financial performance and align the interests of our executive officers with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that giving our shareholders the right to cast an advisory vote every year on their approval of the compensation arrangements of our NEOs is a good corporate governance practice and is in the best interests of our shareholders, by allowing our shareholders to provide us with input every year on our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote for the Company to hold future advisory votes to approve the compensation of our NEOs EVERY YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board recommends that the Say on Pay proposal be voted on every year, our shareholders will be able to specify one of four choices for the Frequency Vote on Say on Pay proposal as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) every year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) every two years,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) every three years or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are not voting to approve or disapprove of the Boards recommendation of an annual vote on the Say on Pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this vote is advisory and will not be binding on the Board or the Company, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of our shareholders and the Company to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently than the option most frequently specified by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why am I receiving these proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These proxy materials are being furnished to you in connection with the solicitation of proxies by our Board of Directors for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on May 4, 2017 at 10:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ET at the Companys headquarters located at 7950 Jones Branch Drive, McLean, Virginia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement furnishes you with the information you need in order to vote, whether or not you attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On what proposals am I being asked to vote and how does the Board recommend that I vot
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are being asked to vote on the Proposals below, and the Board recommends that you vote as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1FOR the election of the eleven director nominees nominated by the Board of Directors, each to hold office until the Companys 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 2FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of the Companys named executive officers as disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section and accompanying compensation tables and related discussion contained in this Proxy Statement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4FOR, on an advisory basis, the Company to hold future shareholder advisory votes to approve the compensation of our named executive officers EVERY YEAR (as opposed to every two years or every three years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if you grant a proxy, your shares will be voted in the discretion of the proxy holder on any Proposal for which you do not register a vote and any other business that properly comes before the Annual Meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Will there be any other items of business addressed at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, we are not aware of any other matter to be presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matters properly come before the Annual Meeting, it is intended that the holders of the proxies will act in accordance with their best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What must I do if I want to attend the Annual Meeting in person?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Admission to the Annual Meeting is by ticket only.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will provide each shareholder with one admission ticket upon request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Either you or your proxy may use your ticket.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record and plan to attend the Annual Meeting, please call the Companys shareholder services department at (703) 873-6677 to request a ticket.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares through an intermediary, such as a bank or broker, and you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, please send a written request for a ticket, along with proof of share ownership, such as a bank or brokerage firm account statement or a letter from the intermediary holding your shares, confirming ownership to: Secretary, TEGNA Inc., 7950 Jones Branch Drive, McLean, Virginia 22107.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests for admission tickets will be processed in the order in which they are received and must be received no later than April 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To obtain directions to attend the Annual Meeting, please call the Companys shareholder services department at (703) 873-6677.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who may vote at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you owned Company stock at the close of business on March 6, 2017, which is the record date for the Annual Meeting (the Record Date), then you may attend and vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please bring proof of your common stock ownership, such as a current brokerage statement, and photo identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares through a bank, broker, or other intermediary, you must obtain a valid legal proxy, executed in your favor, from the holder of record if you wish to vote those shares at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the close of business on the Record Date, we had approximately 214,778,799 shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share is entitled to one vote on each proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What constitutes a quorum for the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence, in person or by proxy, of the holders of a majority of the shares of common stock outstanding on the Record Date will constitute a quorum to conduct business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares held by an intermediary, such as a banker or a broker, that are voted by the intermediary on any or all matters will be treated as shares present for purposes of determining the presence of a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes (defined below) will be counted for the purpose of determining the existence of a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive a one-page notice in the mail regarding the Internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) rules, we are permitted to provide access to our proxy materials over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we are sending a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders will have the ability to access the proxy materials on a website referred to in the Notice or request to receive a printed set of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions on how to access the proxy materials over the Internet or to request a printed copy may be found in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, shareholders may request to receive proxy materials in printed form by mail or electronically by email on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choosing to receive your proxy materials electronically will save us the cost of printing and mailing documents to you and will reduce the impact of our annual shareholders meetings on the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to receive future proxy materials electronically, you will receive an email next year with instructions containing a link to those materials and a link to the proxy voting site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election to receive proxy materials electronically will remain in effect until you terminate it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I get electronic access to the proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement and the Companys 2016 Annual Report may be viewed online on the Companys investor relations website at investors.tegna.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can also elect to receive an email that will provide an electronic link to future Annual Reports and Proxy Statements rather than receiving paper copies of these documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choosing to receive your proxy materials electronically will save us the cost of printing and mailing documents to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can choose to receive future proxy materials electronically by visiting our investor relations website at investors.tegna.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to receive future proxy materials electronically, you will receive an email next year with instructions containing a link to those materials and a link to the proxy voting site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your choice to receive proxy materials electronically will remain in effect until you terminate it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the difference between holding shares as a shareholder of record and as a beneficial owner of shares held in street name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our transfer agent, Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, you are considered the shareholder of record with respect to those shares, and the Notice was sent directly to you by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street Name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in an account at a brokerage firm, bank, broker-dealer, or other similar organization, then you are the beneficial owner of shares held in street name, and the Notice was forwarded to you by your bank, broker or other intermediary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The organization holding your account is considered the shareholder of record for purposes of voting at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a beneficial owner, you have the right to direct that organization on how to vote the shares held in your account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I am a shareholder of record of Company shares, how do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record, you may vote in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will give you a ballot when you arrive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not wish to vote in person or if you will not be attending the Annual Meeting, you may vote by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote by proxy v the Internet or by telephone by following the instructions provided in the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or, if you request printed copies of the proxy materials by mail, you can also vote by mail, by telephone or via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I am a beneficial owner of shares held in street name, how do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name and you wish to vote in person at the Annual Meeting, you must obtain a valid legal proxy from the organization that holds your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not wish to vote in person or you will not be attending the Annual Meeting, you may vote by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Follow the instructions provided to you by your bank, broker or other intermediary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What happens if I do not give specific voting instructions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record and you:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indicate when voting via the Internet or by telephone that you wish to vote as recommended by our Board of Directors; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sign and return a proxy card without giving specific voting instructions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: then the proxy holders will vote your shares in the manner recommended by our Board on all matters presented in this Proxy Statement and as the proxy holders may determine in their discretion with respect to any other matters properly presented for a vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners of Shares Held in Street Name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name and do not provide the organization that holds your shares with specific voting instructions, under the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) rules, the organization that holds your shares may generally vote on routine matters (including Proposal 2 to ratify our appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017) but cannot vote on non-routine matters (including he uncontested director election described in Proposal 1 and the non-binding advisory votes described in Proposals 3 and 4).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the organization that holds your shares does not receive instructions from you on how to vote your shares on a non-routine matter, the organization that holds your shares will inform our Inspector of Election that it does not have the authority to vote on this matter with espect to your shares and your shares will not be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is generally referred to as a broker non-vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When our Inspector of Election tabulates the votes for any particular matter, broker non-votes will be counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present, but will not otherwise be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to provide voting instructions to the organization that holds your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I change or revoke my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you deliver a proxy by mail, by telephone or via the Internet, you have the right to revoke your proxy in writing (by mailing another proxy bearing a later date), by phone (by another call at a later time), via the Internet (by voting online at a later time), by attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person, or by notifying the Company before the Annual Meeting that you want to revoke your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submitting your vote by mail, telephone or via the Internet will not affect your right to vote in person if you decide to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are the votes required to adopt the proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of our common stock outstanding on the Record Date is entitled to one vote on each of the director nominees and one vote on each other matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be elected, directors must receive a majority of the votes cast with respect to that director (the number of shares voted for a director nominee must exceed the number of votes cast against that nominee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the selection of our independent registered public accounting firm and the non-binding advisory vote to adopt the resolution to approve the Companys executive compensation program described in this Proxy Statement each require the affirmative vote of the majority of the shares of common stock present or represented by proxy and entitled to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The choice  1 year, 2 years, or 3 years  for the frequency of future non-binding advisory votes to approve executive compensation that receives the highest number of votes will be considered by the Company as the shareholders recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions, if any, will have no effect on the election of any director or the frequency of future Say on Pay votes, but will have the same effect as votes against each of the other two proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote my shares in the Companys Dividend Reinvestment and 401(k) Plans?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you participate in the Companys Dividend Reinvestment Plan, the TEGNA 401(k) Savings Plan or in the Gannett Co., Inc. 401(k) Savings Plan, your shares of stock in those plans can be voted in the same manner as shares held of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not give instructions, your shares held in the Dividend Reinvestment Plan will not be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares in the TEGNA 401(k) Savings Plan for which no instructions are received will be voted in the same proportion as instructions provided to the trustee by other TEGNA 401(k) Savings Plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares in the Gannett 401(k) Plan for which no instructions are received will be voted in the same proportion as instructions provided to the trustee by other Gannett 401(k) Plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I submit a shareholder proposal or nominate a director for election at the 2018 Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be eligible for inclusion in the proxy materials for the Companys 2018 Annual Meeting, a shareholder proposal must be submitted in writing to TEGNA Inc., 7950 Jones Branch Drive, McLean, Virginia 22107, Attn: Secretary and must be received by November 17, 2017 A shareholder who wishes to present a proposal or nomination at the Companys 2018 Annual Meeting, but who does not request that he Company solicit proxies for the proposal or nomination, must submit the proposal or nomination to the Company at the same address no earlier than January 4, 2018 and no later than January 24, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys By-laws require that any proposal or nomination must contain specific information in order to be validly submitted for consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can shareholders and other interested parties communicate directly with our Board?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company invites shareholders and other interested parties to communicate directly and confidentially with the full Board of Directors, the Chairman of the Board or the non-management directors as a group by writing to the Board of Directors, the Chairman or the Non-Management Directors, TEGNA Inc., 7950 Jones Branch Drive, McLean, Virginia 22107, Attn: Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Secretary will forward such communications to the intended recipient and will retain copies for the Companys records.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A list of shareholders entitled to vote at the 2017 Annual Meeting will be open to examination by any shareholder, for any purpose germane to the 2017 Annual Meeting, during normal business hours, for a period of ten days before the 2017 Annual Meeting and during the 2017 Annual Meeting at the Companys offices at 7950 Jones Branch Drive, McLean, Virginia 22107.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is householding?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a procedure approved by the SEC called householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this procedure, shareholders of record who have the same address and last name who have elected to receive paper copies of our proxy materials will receive only one copy of our 2016 Annual Report and this Proxy Statement unless one or more of these shareholders notifies us that they wish to continue receiving multiple copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This procedure will reduce our printing costs and postage fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if any shareholder residing at such an address wishes to receive a separate copy of this Proxy Statement or the Companys 2016 Annual Report, he or she may contact the Companys Secretary at TEGNA Inc., 7950 Jones Branch Drive, McLean, Virginia 22107 or by calling the Secretary at (703) 873-6600.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such shareholder may also contact the Secretary using the above contact information if he or she would like to receive separate Proxy Statements and Annual Reports in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are receiving multiple copies of the Companys Annual Report and Proxy Statement, you may request householding in the future by contacting the Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How may I obtain a copy of the Companys 2016 Annual Report?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of our 2016 Annual Report, which includes the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, is being provided or made available to all shareholders of record on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by the SEC, the Company is sending a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials to all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares of record on the Record Date, you may request email or paper copies of our 2016 Annual Report over the Internet, at www.investorelections.com/tgna, by toll-free telephone call (in the U.S. and Canada) to 1-866-870-3684, or by email at paper@investorelections.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please put TGNA Materials Request in the subject line and include the 11-digit control number presented on the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares on the Record Date in street name through a bank, broker or other intermediary, you also may have the opportunity to receive copies of our 2016 Annual Report electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please check the information in the proxy materials provided by your bank, broker or other intermediary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also obtain a copy without charge by writing to: TEGNA Inc., 7950 Jones Branch Drive, McLean, Virginia 22107, Attn: Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Annual Report and 2016 Form 10-K are also available through the Companys website at www.tegna.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Annual Report and Form 10-K are not proxy soliciting materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
